Posts.Content: Kim1966 wrote: I had a routine mammo Feb 21st, my DR office called on March 12 that they needed another one of my left breat only as the first one was undefined?   Still not 100% sure what that ment but then today I go for my 2nd mammo this morning, she told me she was going to take 2 images including a "cone" image.  She does one and says let me ask him if this is enough, she coems back and they want the 2nd image.  So after waiting about 15 mins she says they now require a ultrasound.   The girl does the ultrasound and I did see a black oval mass, she tells me to wait and make she the radiologiest has allhe needs.   Wellhe comes back in with her and does it as well,   He says to her I can't find what you did so she tells him 1o'clock and he finds it but doesn't spend alot of time onit does a few more angles and tells me he is done.  I asked him if he could please tell me something.  He said it was unexciting.  I looked confused and he said that is good.  So I repeated....exciting and both of them said unexciting.  However,  I know there was mas cause she measured it and he did find it.   I am trying to think positively cause he did say unexciting but still kinda worried about what it could be.  Any ideas?
